text: Toomas Frey (13 December 1937– 23 September 2020) was an Estonian ecologist, geobotanist and forest scientist.Priist Kask (16 June 2010). "Teenekas ökoloog Toomas Frey 70" (in Estonian), Eesti mets. Retrieved 31 December 2010. Frey was born in Põltsamaa. He was also a political leader, with the Estonian Greens. When he was named Minister of the Environment in 1990, it was the first time a member of a green party reached a national position in an Eastern European government.Wolfgang Rudig (April 2002). "Between Ecotopia and disillusionment: Green parties in European government", Environment 44 (3): 20–33. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Estonian botanists Category:Estonian ecologists Category:People from Põltsamaa Category:Forestry researchers Category:Estonian Greens politicians Category:Estonian University of Life Sciences alumni Category:Estonian University of Life Sciences faculty Category:University of Tartu faculty Category:Estonian foresters Category:20th-century botanists Category:20th- century Estonian scientists Category:21st-century botanists Category:21st- century Estonian scientists
title: Toomas Frey
